alert.note: Alert for Chesapeake; Suffolk; Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 04 at 7:37PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Camden, northwestern Pasquotank, northern Gates, and northern Currituck Counties, the City of Chesapeake, the southeastern City of Suffolk and the City of Virginia Beach through 815 PM EDT... At 737 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 17 miles northeast of Princess Anne to near Northwest to Gates. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Virginia Beach, Sunbury, Kempsville, Regent University, Great Bridge, South Mills, Deep Creek, Chesapeake, Suffolk, Gates, Fentress, Roduco, Princess Anne, Back Bay, Northwest, Corapeake, Moyock, Knotts Island, South Norfolk and Rudee Heights. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
